PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Justification 
  
1.  The PPTA will (i) support the government to set strategic directions and to design the 
investment project in a participatory manner, (ii) develop technical and financial partnership with 
development partners and selected institutes overseas, (iii) undertake thorough due diligence 
including development of appropriate implementation support, and (iv) ensure project readiness. 
 
B.  Major Outputs and Activities 
 
2.  The main outputs will include (i) an analysis of higher engineering sector; (ii) design of 
overall and specific policy and regulatory framework; (iii) appropriate strategic road mapping for 
developing WCHEEI  in  engineering;  (iv)  detailed  project  design  with reflection  of  analysis, 
recommendations, and agreement with the stakeholders including overseas institutions; and (v) 
due diligence reports required by ADB.

D.  Consulting Services 
 
5.  The TA will mobilize 11 person-months of international and 33.5 person-months national 
consultant inputs, who will work closely with ADB’s processing team.

6.  Consultants will be engaged by ADB in accordance with the Guidelines on the Use of 
Consultants (2013, as amended from time to time). All the consultants will be individually 
recruited. The outline terms of reference for the PPTA consultants are described in paras. 7–15.  
 
7.  Higher  engineering  education  specialists  (international,  7  person-months  and 
national,  10  person-months,  intermittent). The specialists  will  have  more  than  20  years  of 
experience  in  developing  HEE.  Strong  communications  and  team  management  skills  are 
required. He or she will be an expert, with experience in administration and management of 
engineering  education.  He  or  she  will  work  and  collaborate  closely  with  the  individual 
consultants under the TA and will be responsible for ensuring effective coordination and delivery 
of TA consultant team deliverables. 
 
8.  University  governance  specialists (international, 2 person-months and national, 7 
person-months,  intermittent).  The  specialists  will  have  more  than  10  years  of  hands-on 
experience in administration of HEE. Their main task will include (i) design specific autonomous 
governance  arrangements  for  the  WCHEEI;  (ii)  development  of  strategic  and  sustainable 
financing  plan  of  the  WCHEEI  (e.g.,  public  financing,  student  tuition,  student  financial 
assistance, and research); and (iii) propose cost-recovery mechanism and recovery ratios in a 
phased manner (through tuition, revenues from research projects, etc.). 
 
9.  Economics,  finance,  and  costing  specialists (international, 2 person-months and 
national, 4 person-months). The specialists will have experience of economic and financial 
analysis of education sector projects as well as project costing. Experiences in ADB and World 
Bank projects are preferred. Their main task will include (i) conducting a detailed economic and 
financial analysis of the project, and (ii) preparing cost estimates of the project with detailed cost 
tables.  
 
10.  Procurement specialist (national, 2.5 person-months, intermittent). The consultant will 
have at least 15 years of experience in public procurement and projects funded by development 
partners.  The  consultant  will  conduct  a  procurement  capacity  assessment  of  the  relevant 
agencies for a proposed project, and provide recommendations for improvements to current 
procurement practices. The consultant will also help develop a procurement plan to support 
potential investments in engineering and technical education. 
 
11.  Fiduciary risk management specialist (national, 2 person-months, intermittent). The 
consultant will have at least 10 years of experience in accounting, financial management, or 
project management. Preferably, he or she worked for a recognized professional accountancy 
or finance qualification such as Chartered Accountant, Certified Public Accountant, Chartered 
Financial Analyst, etc. Experience with ADB or World Bank’s financial management assessment 
is required. The consultant will review and analyze the funds flow mechanism and financial 
management arrangements of identified agencies, and recommend areas for improvements.

12  Appendix 3 
 
12.  Social  development  and  gender  specialist  (national,  2  person-months).  The 
consultant will have at least 10 years of experience in analyzing and assessing gender and 
social inclusion issues in Nepal. The tasks will include (i) conducting poverty, social, ethnic and 
gender impact assessments; and (ii) preparing poverty reduction and social strategy, indigenous 
peoples’ plan, and gender action plan.  
 
13.  Civil  works/architecture  specialist  (national,  3  person-months).  The  specialist  will 
have at least 10 years in building design of education facilities particularly of campuses and 
universities. The specialist will (i) collect data and analyze the cost norms for civil works and 
prepare  a  realistic  schedule  and  cost  estimates  for  design,  supervision,  inspection,  and 
maintenance  of  civil  works  to  be  planned  under  the  proposed  project;  and  (ii)  work  with 
procurement specialists and prepare procurement plan and bidding documents. 
 
14.  Environment specialist (national, 2 person-months). The consultant will have at least 
10  years  of  relevant  experience  in  environmental  assessments  and  management  plans. 
Experience with the environmental safeguard work of ADB or World Bank is required. The 
consultant will conduct environmental assessment and prepare due diligence documents in line 
with ADB’s Safeguard Policy Statement (2009).  
 
15.  Resettlement specialist (national, 2 person-months). The consultant will have at least 
10 years of relevant experience in resettlement in Nepal. Experience with the environmental 
safeguard work of ADB or World Bank is required. The consultant will screen the site identified 
for civil  works, and prepare due diligence documents in line with ADB’s Safeguard Policy 
Statement (2009).  
 
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
16.  The executing agency of the TA will be MOE. ADB will administer the TA and work 
closely with the executing agency. All consultants will be recruited individually. The government 
will provide (i) counterpart staff, and (ii) coordination support. All disbursements under the TA 
will be made in accordance with ADB’s Technical Assistance Disbursement Handbook (2010, 
as amended from time to time). The equipment procured under the TA will be handed over to 
the government upon TA completion. Implementation period of the PPTA will be from 1 Jan 
2016–30 Jun 2017 to ensure project readiness. 
 
17.  The proposed TA processing and implementation schedule is listed in Table A3.4.  
 
Table A3.4: Technical Assistance Processing and Implementation Schedule

Source: Asian Development Bank estimates.
